instruction: What kinds of spectrum were on recognizing the isolates of dark septate endophytic (DSE) fungal?
Output: On recognizing the isolates of dark septate endophytic (DSE) fungal,the researchers used visible spectrum and nir spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on recognizing the isolates of dark septate endophytic (DSE) fungal?
Output: Threshold values were used to segment the regions of fungal growth from the culture medium based on the reﬂectance values at 649.6 nm for VNIR and 1,588 nm for SWIR.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance on recognizing the isolates of dark septate endophytic (DSE) fungal, and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the CNN models in the classification of fungal isolates is precision, recall, and overall accuracy. The results of the study show that the best performance achieved by the hybrid CNN architecture is 100% for precision, recall, and overall accuracy. This means that the CNN models were able to correctly classify all the fungal isolates in the dataset without any false positives or false negatives. Therefore, the chosen metric of precision, recall, and overall accuracy can go as far as achieving perfect classification results in this particular study.

instruction: What are the different spectral pre-processing techniques investigated in the research on recognizing the isolates of dark septate endophytic (DSE) fungal using deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs)?
Output: The different spectral pre-processing techniques investigated in the research on recognizing the isolates of dark septate endophytic (DSE) fungal using deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs) are standard normal variate (SNV), continuum removal (CR), De-trending (DET), and 1st derivatives (FST).

instruction: Can the hybrid CNN architecture (3D-2D CNN) be used for recognizing dark septate endophytic (DSE) fungal isolates in hyperspectral images, and how does its performance compare to traditional methods?
Output: Yes, the hybrid CNN architecture (3D-2D CNN) can be used for recognizing dark septate endophytic (DSE) fungal isolates in hyperspectral images. The performance of the hybrid CNN architecture was compared to traditional methods in the study. The results showed that the hybrid CNN architecture achieved the best performance for the classification of fungal isolates on short-wave-infrared (SWIR) hyperspectral data compared to the same architecture on visible-near-infrared (VNIR) hyperspectral data. The best performance achieved by the hybrid CNN architecture was 100% for precision, recall, and overall accuracy. This indicates that the hybrid CNN approach is highly effective in accurately classifying fungal isolates in hyperspectral images. In contrast, traditional methods typically require manual feature extraction and may not achieve the same level of accuracy and efficiency as the hybrid CNN approach.
